channel.title: Method drawText , Cannot be applied to given types!
channel.description:
Can someone please help me out with this iv'e been searching all over!!!
I was adding my xp counter

item.title: Method drawText , Cannot be applied to given types!
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“Damoiscool, post:23, topic:551469”][quote author=tank nation link=topic=670385.msg4482767#msg4482767 date=1431355956]

You need as many these ( as these )

I done that, and amazingly this is what i get…

private void drawCounterOnScreen() {
int x = 520;
int y = 47;
counter[2].drawSprite(x-100, y+8);
int i = aTextDrawingArea_1271.getTextWidth(Integer.toString(xpCounter));
aTextDrawingArea_1271.drawText(0xffffff, “XP:”, y+21, x-88);
aTextDrawingArea_1271.drawText(0xffffff, Integer.toString(xpCounter));
if (expAdded = 0); {
i = smallText.getTextWidth(Integer.toString(expAdded)+“xp”);
smallText.drawText(0xff9933, Integer.toString(expAdded)+“xp”, y+21+18+xpAddedPos, x-12-i);
xpAddedPos += 2;
if (xpAddedPos >= 50) {
xpAddedPos = 0;
expAdded = 0;
}
}
}
[/quote]

Are you reading the compiler errors or just posting them for spoonfeeding?

REALLY REALLY LONG OVER-EMPHASISED SIGH

Replace this

with this

and this

with this

READ IT. UNDERSTAND IT. RESPECT IT.[/quote]

Thank you sooo much!, i noticed that i almost had it right but was a bit confused take a look at what i had lol.

aTextDrawingArea_1271.drawText(0xffffff, y+21, x-12-i), Integer.toString(xpCounter); I just didnt understand where these things went which was confusing me! lol

Read full topic

Are you reading the compiler errors or just posting them for spoonfeeding?

REALLY REALLY LONG OVER-EMPHASISED SIGH

Replace this

with this

and this

with this

READ IT. UNDERSTAND IT. RESPECT IT.

item.title: Method drawText , Cannot be applied to given types!
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“Damoiscool, post:18, topic:551469”][quote author=tank nation link=topic=670385.msg4482732#msg4482732 date=1431324532]

You have yet another semi-colon where it should not be.

Okay thanks! Btw I think i fixed it but ran into a new error , illegal start of expression “if (expAdded != 0) {”[/quote]

I see 0 semi-colons in that quote.
In those 3 errors you just showed me (Which are all on the same line), I see 1 semi-colon in the exact same spot every time.

Same error, private void drawCounterOnScreen() {
int x = 520;
int y = 47;
counter[2].drawSprite(x-100, y+8);
int i = aTextDrawingArea_1271.getTextWidth(Integer.toString(xpCounter));
aTextDrawingArea_1271.drawText(0xffffff, “XP:”, y+21, x-88);
aTextDrawingArea_1271.drawText(0xffffff, Integer.toString(xpCounter),
if (expAdded = 0) {
i = smallText.getTextWidth(Integer.toString(expAdded)+“xp”);

If you run into problems like this try to fix them yourself before asking others, you’ll learn more that way. Find out where the problem lies, then compare it to statements/loops of the same type to see if anything is out of place. There should always be the same amount of these { as there are of these }, semicolons ; basically end a statement , commas separate integers (A whole number), strings, floats, booleans etc… Now I have put the part where the problem lies in red, see if you can use what I’ve just told you to see if you can fix it. Small errors and symbols, spaces, letters, curly brackets etc. out of place can give you errors, always remember to double check what you’ve added, if you get an error go back to the same spot or back up.[/quote]

I fixed it down to this…

private void drawCounterOnScreen() {
int x = 520;
int y = 47;
counter[2].drawSprite(x-100, y+8);
int i = aTextDrawingArea_1271.getTextWidth(Integer.toString(xpCounter));
aTextDrawingArea_1271.drawText(0xffffff, “XP:”, y+21, x-88);
aTextDrawingArea_1271.drawText(0xffffff, Integer.toString(xpCounter);
if (expAdded = 0); {
i = smallText.getTextWidth(Integer.toString(expAdded)+“xp”);
smallText.drawText(0xff9933, Integer.toString(expAdded)+“xp”, y+21+18+xpAddedPos, x-12-i);
xpAddedPos += 2;
if (xpAddedPos >= 50) {
xpAddedPos = 0;
expAdded = 0;
}
}
}

Read full topic

item.title: Method drawText , Cannot be applied to given types!
item.dc:creator: @Damoiscool Damoiscool
item.description:
@Damoiscool wrote:

[quote=“tank nation, post:17, topic:551469”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=670385.msg4482731#msg4482731 date=1431324357]
You have yet another semi-colon where it should not be.

Okay thanks! Btw I think i fixed it but ran into a new error , illegal start of expression “if (expAdded != 0) {”[/quote]

I see 0 semi-colons in that quote.
In those 3 errors you just showed me (Which are all on the same line), I see 1 semi-colon in the exact same spot every time.

Same error, private void drawCounterOnScreen() {
int x = 520;
int y = 47;
counter[2].drawSprite(x-100, y+8);
int i = aTextDrawingArea_1271.getTextWidth(Integer.toString(xpCounter));
aTextDrawingArea_1271.drawText(0xffffff, “XP:”, y+21, x-88);
aTextDrawingArea_1271.drawText(0xffffff, Integer.toString(xpCounter),
if (expAdded = 0) {
i = smallText.getTextWidth(Integer.toString(expAdded)+“xp”);[/quote]

If you run into problems like this try to fix them yourself before asking others, you’ll learn more that way. Find out where the problem lies, then compare it to statements/loops of the same type to see if anything is out of place. There should always be the same amount of these { as there are of these }, semicolons ; basically end a statement , commas separate integers (A whole number), strings, floats, booleans etc… Now I have put the part where the problem lies in red, see if you can use what I’ve just told you to see if you can fix it. Small errors and symbols, spaces, letters, curly brackets etc. out of place can give you errors, always remember to double check what you’ve added, if you get an error go back to the same spot or back up.

item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:14, topic:551469”][quote author=tank nation link=topic=670385.msg4482727#msg4482727 date=1431323355]

If you actually analyze the problem you would have just figured out the error.

“First reply” is the first quote of yours in my reply to this post… You know, the thing you just quoted? That is a reply.
The second reply, is the second quote of yours in my reply…

I even bolded the words for you…

I know that’s the error and problem what do i add or remove to get the error to be gone…
[/quote]

As I just said.
The second reply is the one with the error
By process of elimination, that means the first reply is correct.

Again, take a look at them:

Okay thanks! Btw I think i fixed it but ran into a new error , illegal start of expression “if (expAdded != 0) {”
^

[quote author=tank nation link=topic=670385.msg4482723#msg4482723 date=1431321953]
private void drawCounterOnScreen() {
int x = 520;
int y = 47;
counter[2].drawSprite(x-100, y+8);
int i = aTextDrawingArea_1271.getTextWidth(Integer.toString(xpCounter));
aTextDrawingArea_1271.drawText(0xffffff, “XP:”, y+21, x-88);
aTextDrawingArea_1271.drawText(0xffffff, Integer.toString(xpCounter),
problem—> if ;expAdded = 0; {
i = smallText.getTextWidth(Integer.toString(expAdded)+“xp”);
smallText.drawText(0xff9933, Integer.toString(expAdded)+“xp”, y+21+18+xpAddedPos, x-12-i);
xpAddedPos += 2;
if (xpAddedPos >= 50) {
xpAddedPos = 0;
expAdded = 0;
}
}
}
[/quote][/quote]

This is what you don’t understand, no matter what im getting this error!

item.title: Method drawText , Cannot be applied to given types!
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

Look at the code you wrote into your first reply, and then look at the code in your second. You will literally see the error.[quote=“tank nation, post:7, topic:551469”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=670385.msg4482720#msg4482720 date=1431318250]
https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/nutsandbolts/datatypes.html

private void drawCounterOnScreen() {
int x = 520;
int y = 47;
counter[2].drawSprite(x-100, y+8);
int i = aTextDrawingArea_1271.getTextWidth(Integer.toString(xpCounter));
aTextDrawingArea_1271.drawText(0xffffff, “XP:”, y+21, x-88);
aTextDrawingArea_1271.drawText(0xffffff, Integer.toString(xpCounter),
problem—> if ;expAdded = 0; {
i = smallText.getTextWidth(Integer.toString(expAdded)+“xp”);
smallText.drawText(0xff9933, Integer.toString(expAdded)+“xp”, y+21+18+xpAddedPos, x-12-i);
xpAddedPos += 2;
if (xpAddedPos >= 50) {
xpAddedPos = 0;
expAdded = 0;
}
}
}

Note: The second reply is the one with the error.[/quote]

First reply? second reply what do you mean…? be more specific this is a little complicated, can you just tell me how to fix this error so i have a better understanding i don’t just copy and paste i actually analyze the problem and see what was needed and how it was fixed.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:551469”]actually, it needs you to remove an argument.

Again… look at the length
(int, String, int, int) is what is required.

You have:
(int, String, int, int, BOOLEAN)

Something tells me the last value may be what’s causing the error.

For future reference please give us the code in text format (by putting it in code tags) or upload it onto a site like pastebin. It’s extra (and unnecessary) work for us to re-type your entire code (Especially in this scenario where you’re removing 5 letters and a comma.) to show what’s wrong or a solution.[/quote]

I know, sorry… Can you explain what a int is, what it looks like to me is just a bunch of coding.

Read full topic

item.source: Method drawText , Cannot be applied to given types!

item.title: Method drawText , Cannot be applied to given types!
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:551469”]The method “drawText” expects 4 arguments.
An int, A string, an int, and another int.

Your code contains: an int, a String, an int, an int, and a boolean.

Do you see the issue now?

Here’s another example.

int something = 10; public void doSomething() { if(something > 0) { doSomething(1); } }
Ignoring the fact that the code would just constantly repeat… You can clearly see I supplied an int in the method (within the if statement), but the method clearly does not require one as an argument. Thus, giving you the error you see on your compiler.[/quote]

Sorry im really dumbfounded, about int and string , ect… here’s my code could you help me fix… i understand it needs an argument to be completed but not to sure. it’s easier for me to understand once i see the problem.

Read full topic
item.source: Method drawText , Cannot be applied to given types!

item.title: Method drawText , Cannot be applied to given types!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

The method “drawText” expects 4 arguments.
An int, A string, an int, and another int.

Your code contains: an int, a String, an int, an int, and a boolean.

Do you see the issue now?

Here’s another example.

int something = 10; public void doSomething() { if(something > 0) { doSomething(1); } }
Ignoring the fact that the code would just constantly repeat… You can clearly see I supplied an int in the method (within the if statement), but the method clearly does not require one as an argument. Thus, giving you the error you see on your compiler.

Read full topic
